Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

15CF13 & 14CF156 Cases called @ 2:44 p.m. Defendant Shawn J. Knaup in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CF13: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CF13: Cts 2 - DRI. 14CF156: DRI. The court orders preparation of a PSI at the request of the parties. 14CFR-156 and 15CF-13:  NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Goldin states still reviewing discovery - expects matter to be resolved.  P/S Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on March 17, 2015 at 09:05 am.

14CF-156 and 15CF-13 - Both Cases Called @ 3:50 PM: Defendant Shawn J. Knaup in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF-13:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Goldin reserves all jurisdiction issues.  Def is prepared to waive the pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Atty Goldin confirms that waiver is as to both cases.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing as to both pending cases. Def BOT.  15CF-13  INFO filed - Receipt Admitted - Readings Waived.  NGP received and entered.  Counsel expect to work out a global resolution which will include revocation issues also.  14CF-156:  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 09:05 am.
Status conference on February 4, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2015 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:33 p.m. Defendant Shawn J. Knaup in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Initial appearance on October 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:06 p.m.  Defendant Shawn J. Knaup in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
